content.question: The particle diagrams above represent a change in physical state that occurred after heating two separate solid samples of a diatomic element. Which of the following best compares the relative magnitude of <math alttext="delta S naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and gives the sign for the entropy change undergone by each sample, and why?

choices.label: The entropy values for both samples are positive and <math alttext="delta S naught of sample 2 equals delta S naught of sample 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>e</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, because the changes observed for both samples required a net input of energy from the surroundings.

The entropy values for both samples are negative and <math alttext="delta S naught of sample 2 equals delta S naught of sample 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>e</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, because the changes observed for both samples released energy to the surroundings.

The entropy values for both samples are positive and <math alttext="delta S naught of sample 2 is greater than delta S naught of sample 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>e</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, because the change in the spatial distribution of the molecules was greater for sample 2 than for sample 1.

The entropy values for both samples are negative and <math alttext="delta S naught of sample 2 is less than delta S naught of sample 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>e</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, because the change in the spatial distribution of the molecules was greater for sample 2 than for sample 1.
